page.title:
By Peter Yin, Port of Los Angeles ASCE-COPRI Reconnaissance Team Member
By Peter Yin, Port of Los Angeles
ASCE-COPRI Reconnaissance Team Member

Following the Sumatra Earthquake and Tsunami ASCE sent Reconnaissance Teams to Thailand, India and Sri Lanka.
Following the Sumatra Earthquake and Tsunami
ASCE sent Reconnaissance Teams to
Thailand, India and Sri Lanka.

page.title:
Southwest Sri Lanka Coast
Southwest Sri Lanka Coast
page.normal_text:
Part I : Building Performance
Part I : Building Performance

page.title:
Heavy losses occurred at west coastline of Sri Lanka, area does not face the origin of tsunami.
Heavy losses occurred at west coastline of Sri Lanka, area
does not face the origin of tsunami.

Panadura, 25 km South of Colombo Nearly all houses along this west coast line were destroyed.
Panadura, 25 km South of Colombo
Nearly all houses along this west coast line were destroyed.

Hambantota, S.E. Lanka: 11 m (33 ft) water level was the highest.
Hambantota, S.E. Lanka:
11 m (33 ft) water level was the highest.

Hambantota: 4,500 people perished at this fishing town.
Hambantota:
4,500 people perished at this fishing town.

East Sri Lanka (AP Photo): Raging water at beach front properties.
East Sri Lanka (AP Photo):
Raging water at beach front properties.

East Sri Lanka: From Kalmunai to Batticaloa, many houses ended up like this one at the coast line.
East Sri Lanka:
From Kalmunai to Batticaloa, many houses ended up like this
one at the coast line.

East Sri Lanka: Another ocean front community. Un-reinforced brick and/or masonry construction were typical in the region.
East Sri Lanka:
Another ocean front community. Un-reinforced brick and/or
masonry construction were typical in the region.

Common damages: Un-reinforced masonry structures were no match for the wave, but reinforced concrete members survived.
Common damages: Un-reinforced masonry structures were
no match for the wave, but reinforced concrete members
survived.

Another comparison between un-reinforced and reinforced members.
Another comparison between un-reinforced and reinforced
members.

In the same region, properly designed and constructed buildings suffered minimum damages.
In the same region, properly designed and constructed
buildings suffered minimum damages.

Inside the same ocean front building. Only glass windows were broken.
Inside the same ocean front building. Only glass windows
were broken.

Part II: Infrastructures
Part II:
Infrastructures
page.normal_text:
South of Kalutara: Railroad bridge was destroyed, highway bridge next to it was not.
South of Kalutara:
Railroad bridge was destroyed, highway bridge next to it was not.

picture.name: Image97
picture.caption: River connect to the ocean collected most of the flow. Bridge and abutment at upper stream were washed away by receding water. The highway bridge facing in-coming surge survived.

page.title:
Arugam Bay:Bridge at southeast coastline Water over-flowed the superstructure.
Arugam Bay:Bridge at southeast coastline A r u g a m
B a y : B r i d g e
a t
s o u t h e a s t
c o a s t l i n e
Water over-flowed the superstructure.

South abutment and approach road were washed away.
South abutment and approach road were washed away.

Expansion joint still there, high above the water.
Expansion joint still there, high above the water.

Approach road and abutments connecting the two bridges were gone.
Approach road and abutments connecting the two bridges
were gone.

Doomed morning ride at Bentota, 60 km south of Colombo: Railroad track was several thousand feet from the ocean, but the water level reached 20 ft or more above the ground at this location.
Doomed morning ride at Bentota, 60 km south of Colombo:
Railroad track was several thousand feet from the ocean, but the water
level reached 20 ft or more above the ground at this location.

picture.name: Image115
picture.caption: People jumped on the train in the attempt to escape, but the train was toppled and battered by the flood. 1500 lives perished.

picture.name: Image118
picture.caption: Hambantota: Thousands feet away from shoreline, this transmission tower was stuck down by the current with a floated bus. Noted all the houses nearby were destroyed.

page.title:
Along east coastline, from Arugam Bay to Trincomalee Bay, many roads adjacent or connect to lake or lagoon need major repair.
Along east coastline, from Arugam Bay to Trincomalee Bay,
many roads adjacent or connect to lake or lagoon need major repair.

Contrary to the east coast roads, the service roads at the west region suffered minimum damages.
Contrary to the east coast roads, the service roads at the
west region suffered minimum damages.

Waterfront Houses suffered heavy losses
Waterfront Houses
suffered heavy
losses

picture.name: Image135
picture.caption: Tricomalee Inner Harbor: Even though fierce surge attacked outer harbor, narrow entrance minimized the damages to the inner harbor facilities.

page.title:
Tricomalee Outer Harbor: Almost all the houses at coast line were destroyed.
Tricomalee Outer Harbor:
Almost all the houses at coast line were destroyed.

The Port of Galle, Southwest Sri Lanka: Water was 10 ft above the deck and port buildings.
The Port of Galle, Southwest Sri Lanka:
Water was 10 ft above the deck and port buildings.

No major damage was reported, even though 2 m (6’) of silt filled the inner harbor and a 650 ton ship was tossed to on top of the deck.
No major damage was reported, even though 2 m (6’) of silt
filled the inner harbor and a 650 ton ship was tossed to on
top of the deck.

Port of Colombo •General cargo terminal and 2 container terminals •12-15 m draft (Jaya) and 9-11 m draft (SAGT) •2 million T.E.U in 2004 •Reinforced concrete deck on piles •200 Ha water area, 130 Ha land area

page.normal_text:
The Port of Colombo
The Port of Colombo

page.title:
Tsunami brought no surging waves, but fast rising water.
Tsunami brought no surging waves, but fast rising water.

Three feet of water covered the wharfs before receding.
Three feet of water covered the wharfs before receding.

picture.name: Image161
picture.caption: Minor damages occurred near light house when a ship hit the breakwater (slipped away from the wharf by receding water).

page.title:

Observation in
Southeast India:
page.normal_text:
Ports visited: Chennai Ennore & Fishing harbors
Ports visited:
Chennai
Ennore
& Fishing harbors

page.title:
Chennai Port, India
Chennai Port, India

picture.name: Image173
picture.caption: Chennai Port: 5 m (16 ft) or higher waves hit the port and fish harbor. (Deck is 4 m above MLLW level)

page.title:
Water receded from the backland.
Water receded from the backland.

picture.name: Image179
picture.caption: Despite the broken mooring line and high water level, wharf structures suffered no damage.

picture.name: Image182
picture.caption: Strong current is clearly visible inside the harbor.

page.title:
Chennai Port, India
Chennai Port, India

Water current circled and swirled around these vessels inside the harbor.
Water current circled and swirled around these vessels
inside the harbor.

Damages caused by collision of floating ship.
Damages caused by collision of floating ship.

Ship floating with the receding water. Broken mooring line is visible.
Ship floating with the receding water. Broken mooring line is
visible.

Receding water scoured the foundation, and deepened the channel by several feet.
Receding water scoured the foundation, and deepened the
channel by several feet.

Pier settlement due to scouring.
Pier settlement due to scouring.

Catwalk and dolphin were knocked out by floating vessel.
Catwalk and dolphin were knocked out by floating vessel.

Most damages on breakwater occurred at the inner side.
Most damages on breakwater occurred at the inner side.

picture.name: Image208
picture.caption: Ennore, the Port for energy, located 24 km north of Chennai.

page.title:
Port staff was well prepared when Tsunami threat was noticed.
Port staff was well prepared when Tsunami threat was
noticed.

picture.name: Image217
picture.caption: Tug boats were used effectively to keep the ship from floating around the harbor.

picture.name: Image220
picture.caption: Sound judgment and timely response averted potential damages at this port.

page.title:

General Findings:

Impacted Area: Reflecting waves may cause damages just as severe as direct surge.

page.title:
Observations on Infrastructures and Buildings:
Observations on Infrastructures and Buildings:
page.enlisting:
• Site specific: Similar to a seismic event, the magnitude of damage is • Receding water caused more bridge and abutment damages at the river • Damages were not limited to immediate costal area. High water level, • Building code enforcement is essential. Almost all property that was lost, • Planning and zoning: Low lands or coastal regions subject to monsoons and floods may need special zoning regulations and building height requirements. • Site specific: Similar to a seismic event, the magnitude of damage is

• Building code enforcement is essential. Almost all property that was lost,

subject to many factors. Similar buildings next to each other may have different outcomes.
subject to many factors. Similar buildings next to each other may have

page.title:
Observations on Port Facilities
Observations on Port Facilities
page.enlisting:
• Most modern port structures are capable to resisting tsunami waves. • Depends on layout, geometry, location, water depth, and other hydraulic, • Rising water may break mooring lines. In the ports that have strong • Hydraulic modeling and laboratory test could be considered at major • Breakwater damages generally occurred at inner side of the structure. • Most modern port structures are capable to resisting tsunami waves.
